subject: RE: [junit] Testing getXXX( ) and setXXX( ) methods
msgSnippet: ... boolean isReady; ... public boolean isValid(){ return isReady; } public boolean setValid(boolean ready){ isReady = ready; } ... Well, not very good choices
messageBody:
> -----Original Message-----
> From: J. B. Rainsberger
> Subject: RE: [junit] Testing getXXX( ) and setXXX( ) methods
>
>
>
> >>drunk. As for setting the wrong variable in a setX() method,
> >>see my previous
> >>message. I've made that mistake exactly once.
> >

boolean isReady;
...
public boolean isValid(){
return isReady;
}
public boolean setValid(boolean ready){
isReady = ready;
}
...

Well, not very good choices of names, let's change that

boolean isReady;
...
public boolean isReady(){
return isReady;
}
public boolean setReady(boolean ready){
isReady = ready;
}
...

still don't like the attribute having name like method:

boolean ready;
...
public boolean isReady(){
return ready;
}
public boolean setReady(boolean ready){
ready = ready;
}
...

and oops, setter doesn't work anymore. But this happened only once in the
past year. And I still don't test setters. I just always put "this." in
front...
